text: FC is an acronym. FC stands for "Football Club". In the J.League, the team is one of seven with FC in the club name. is a Japanese professional football clubJsoccer.com, "Japan J.League Teams" ; retrieved 2012-7-5. in Tokyo.Soccerway.com, "FC Tokyo"; retrieved 2012-3-2. ==History== The club was founded in 1935. *1935-1998: Tokyo Gas SC *1999-present: FC Tokyo ==League title== *Japan Football League: 1 **1998 *Emperor's Cup: 1 **2011 ==League position== *2011: J2 League - 1st *2012: J1 League - 10th *2013: J1 League - 8th *2014: J1 League - 9th *2015: J1 League - 4th *2016: J1 League - 9th *2017: J1 League - 13th *2018: J1 League - 6th *2019: J1 League - 2nd *2020: J1 League - 6th ===Former position=== == Notable achievements == The team has some notable achievements. In 2012, Kazuma Watanabe made three goals in one game against Sagan Tosu.WorldFootball.net, "3 Goals in one game"; retrieved 2012-7-5. In 2009, Naohiro Ishikawa scored three times in one game against Omiya Ardija. ==Related pages == * Sports in Japan * List of Japanese football teams * List of FC Tokyo players == References == ==Other websites== * * http://www.FC ; http://www.FC * Tokyo/ J.League Club Guide Category:Football clubs in Tokyo Category:1935 establishments in Japan Category:Sports organizations in Tokyo
title: FC Tokyo
